hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Regime Fade on Failed Volatility Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When the market is in a NEUTRAL regime and experiences a sharp, high-volume volatility spike (≥2.5x 20-day average) that fails to sustain above key moving average resistance (e.g., 50-day SMA), a short position entered at the failure point will be profitable as price reverts toward the neutral range, signaling a transition toward a BEAR regime.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In neutral regimes, liquidity is often thin. A sharp, high-volume move that fails at a key technical level suggests aggressive buyers were trapped, leading to rapid profit-taking and a regime shift toward bearish sentiment as confidence erodes.
entry_conditions: BTC 1-hour candle closes with volume ≥2.5x 20-day average AND price ≥2.5% above previous close
Immediately following candle fails to close above 50-day SMA (BTCUSD)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 61.8% of the volatility spike move OR touches 20-day SMA
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price closes above 50-day SMA on 4-hour chart

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 55% of such signals result in a continuation above the 50-day SMA and a transition to a BULL regime instead.
